description: The tallest structure in Enies Lobby, serving as CP9's headquarters. It contains multiple floors with agent rooms and the director's office, connected to the courthouse by a drawbridge and to the Bridge of Hesitation via an underground passage.

keyEvents.title: Franky Defeats Fukurou in Tower of Justice
keyEvents.description: Franky defeats CP9 agent Fukurou inside the Tower of Justice using his Coup de Vent technique, marking a major victory for the Straw Hat alliance.
keyEvents.significance: The Tower of Justice serves as the battleground for multiple CP9 confrontations during the Enies Lobby rescue mission.

keyEvents.title: Zoro and Sogeking Handcuffed in Tower
keyEvents.description: Zoro and Sogeking find themselves handcuffed together while being pursued by Kaku and Jabra through the Tower of Justice.
keyEvents.significance: Creates a unique combat scenario within the tower's corridors.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Encounters Kumadori in Tower
keyEvents.description: Chopper encounters CP9 agent Kumadori in the Tower of Justice, setting up their battle.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes another major confrontation location within the tower.

statusHistory.reason: Tower is operational during Enies Lobby arc
Tower destroyed along with rest of Enies Lobby by Buster Call

description: A judicial island in the Grand Line that serves as one of the World Government's three main strongholds. Known for never experiencing nighttime due to unique natural phenomena. Contains the courthouse, Tower of Justice, and Gates of Justice leading to Impel Down or Marine Headquarters.

keyEvents.title: Franky Defeats Fukurou
keyEvents.description: Franky defeats one of CP9's agents at Enies Lobby, reducing the enemy forces.
keyEvents.significance: Marks progress in the Straw Hats' assault on Enies Lobby to rescue Robin.

statusHistory.reason: Island is operational as World Government judicial facility

name.japanese: エニエス・ロビーの滝

description: A massive waterfall that surrounds the main island of Enies Lobby, created by water flowing endlessly into a giant hole. The waterfall presents a dangerous hazard for anyone who falls from the island.

keyEvents.title: Franky and Fukurou Near Waterfall
keyEvents.description: During their battle, Franky and Fukurou are drawn toward the waterfall by the currents. Franky uses this dangerous position to deliver his final attack.
keyEvents.significance: The waterfall serves as the dramatic backdrop for Franky's victory over Fukurou.

statusHistory.reason: Natural feature remains despite island's destruction
